results.title: ‘Space Jam,’ My Dad and Me
results.abstract: A writer adored the basketball-Looney Tunes mash-up as a boy. Watching the movie again after his father died, he felt the movie resonate in a surprisingly deeper way.

multimedia.caption: In “Space Jam,” Michael Jordan plays himself, here talking with Eric Gordon, who plays his son.

results.title: Hollywood Head Spinner: Universal Spends Big for New ‘Exorcist’ Trilogy
results.abstract: The deal, expected to be announced this week, is for more than $400 million and is a direct response to the streaming giants that are upending the film industry’s economics.

multimedia.caption: Leslie Odom Jr. will star in a new “Exorcist” trilogy directed by David Gordon Green. Ellen Burstyn will reprise her role from the 1973 classic.

results.title: ‘There’s No One Like Him’: A Times Critic Who Captured the Moment
results.abstract: For his piercing insights on race and culture, Wesley Morris recently received his second Pulitzer Prize. But he won over colleagues long before that.

multimedia.caption: Wesley Morris at the Times headquarters in June after winning the Pulitzer Prize for criticism. He’s the only person to receive the award in that category twice.
Wesley Morris at the Times headquarters in June after winning the Pulitzer Prize for criticism. He’s the only person to receive the award in that category twice.

results.title: ‘Dune’ and Princess Diana Biopic to Debut at a Starry Venice Film Festival
results.abstract: Hollywood blockbusters are back on the program after a less celebrity-driven edition last year, but the event will still be far from business as usual.

results.title: ‘Old’ Review: They Say Sun Can Age You, but This Is Ridiculous
results.abstract: A half-hour at the beach costs vacationers a year in this disquieting new horror puzzler, written and directed by M. Night Shyamalan.

results.title: I’m Obsessed With ‘Old.’ The Twist: I Won’t See It.
results.abstract: M. Night Shyamalan’s new movie has a trailer that eerily resonates with our strange times; and that’s enough for me.

results.title: Study Shows More Disability Stories Onscreen, but Few Disabled Actors
results.abstract: The study published Wednesday also showed that television is far behind film when it comes to representation of characters with disabilities.

results.title: The Cosby Ruling: Some Legal Analysts Dispute the Court’s Reasoning
results.abstract: The court decision that reversed the sexual assault conviction of Bill Cosby has prompted an unusual level of legal debate about the appropriate parameters of appellate review.

multimedia.caption: The Pennsylvania Supreme Court’s decision to overturn the conviction of Bill Cosby has led to a debate about whether it overstepped its bounds as an appeals court.

results.title: Vicky Krieps Gave Hollywood One More Try. It Wasn’t So Bad.
results.abstract: The “Phantom Thread” actress, burned by the experience of promoting the movie in the United States, retreated to art-house obscurity. Now, she’s back in the M. Night Shyamalan blockbuster “Old.”

results.title: The Woman Who Captured ‘Jaws,’ Then Worked to Undo the Damage
results.abstract: A documentary tracks the extraordinary life of Valerie Taylor, spearfishing champion turned passionate conservationist on behalf of endangered sharks.
des_facet: Playing with Sharks: The Valerie Taylor Story (Movie)

multimedia.caption: Valerie Taylor with a prop shark in 1974. Real sharks have different personalities, she said: “Some are shy, some are bullies, some are brave.”

results.title: Vladimir Menshov, Surprise Russian Oscar Winner, Dies at 81
results.abstract: His “Moscow Does Not Believe in Tears” was named best foreign-language film in 1980, beating Truffaut and Kurosawa. U.S. critics demurred.
des_facet: Moscow Does Not Believe in Tears (Movie)

multimedia.caption: The Soviet filmmaker and actor Vladimir Menshov in an undated photo. His “Moscow Does Not Believe in Tears” won an Academy Award in 1980.

results.title: ‘Change is coming’ to streaming, says Jason Kilar, the WarnerMedia chief.
results.abstract: HBO and its streaming service, HBO Max, have attracted 67.5 million customers, and the company expects to reach 73 million by year end.
